details.title: Optimum radar signal for detection in clutter [Correspondence]
details.abstract: It is shown that in order to maximize the detectability of a radar target in clutter whose Doppler is unknown and is uniformly distributed over the Doppler bandwidth a simple CW or narrowband signal is optimal. The optimality criterion is the average deflection coefficient, with the averaging being over target Doppler frequency. Most remarkably the result does not depend on the clutter spectrum but holds for any distribution of clutter energy with frequency.
details.journal_title: IEEE Transactions on Aerospace and Electronic Systems
